 I hope you like it :).

 Version 1.0
 Date: 03.2017
World of Discoveries. Interactive Museum and Theme Park
Fortaleza de Sao Joao da Foz
Hot Five Jazz And Blues Club
Nata Lisboa Rua de Santa Catarina
R. Dr. António Luís Gomes 22–320,\n4000–010 Porto, Portugal
R. de Ferreira Borges,\n4050–253 Porto, Portugal
Praça de Almeida Garrett,\n4000–069 Porto, Portugal
R. de São Filipe de Nery,\n4050–546 Porto, Portugal
Praça de Gonçalves Zarco,\n4100–274 Porto, Portugal
Rua de Santa Catarina 428,\n4000–444 Porto, Portugal
Rua Rei Ramiro 514,\n4400–281 Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal
Rua de Franca 8–10,\nVila Nova de Gaia 4400–174, Portugal
R. Dom Afonso III 2,\n4400–266 Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal
Rua de Choupelo 250,\nVila Nova de Gaia 4400–088, Portugal

Monument to Almeida Garrett

Work of the sculptor Barata Feyo, the sculpture made in bronze on a granite plinth, was erected in front of the City Hall of Porto, in the commemoration of the Centenary of the Death of Almeida Garrett. Almeida Garrett (February 4, 1799 – December 9, 1854) was one of the greatest Portuguese poets, but was also a politician, member of the liberal party and the Minister.

Cathedral of Porto

Address:
Terreiro da Sé,
4050-573 Porto

Price:
Access to the church: Free
Access to the Cloisters: 3,00€

The Cathedral of Porto is a Romanesque church built in the twelfth and thirteenth centuries.

City Hall

Address:
Praça General Humberto Delgado,
4049-001 Porto

Schedule:
Guided visit on first Sunday of each month.

Price:
Guided visit: 2,00€

The City Hall building was designed by the architect Correia da Silva and it\'s construction began in 1920. It\'s tower is 70 meters high, and people can climb it\'s 180 steps to see the view and the carillon clock. Inside the monumental granite building, there are nobly furnished rooms and several elements in marble. In the lobby, it is worth appreciating the romantic style paintings that decorate the ceiling and the two marble statues representing female figures by Henrique Moreira, called “Art” and “Industry”.

Stock Exchange Palace

Address:
Rua Ferreira Borges 
4050-253 Porto

Schedule:
November to March:
9h00 to 12h30 and 14h00 to 17h30.
April to October:
9h00 to 18h30.

Price:
Guided visit: 4,00€ to 7,00€.
Packages that include wine tasting, live fado, visit the wine cellars of Porto and boat or bus trip: 5,00€ to 21,00€.

Built between 1842 and 1910, the Stock Exchange Palace is one of the most beautiful buildings of the city and the home (and property) of the Commercial Association of Porto (Porto Chamber of Commerce), which was founded in 1934. The guided tours last 30 minutes and begin in the Hall of Nations, which is where the ruins of the former cloister of the Convent of St. Francisco once stood.

Bolhao Market

Address:
Rua Formosa,
4000-214 Porto

Schedule:
Monday to Friday:
7h00 to 17h00.
Saturday:
7h00 to 13h00.

The Bolhão Market is one of the most remarkable buildings of the center of Porto and the most iconic market of the city. The market dates back to 1850 and the current building, designed by the architect António Correia da Silva, was inaugurated in 1914.

Crystal Palace

Address:
Rua de D. Manuel II,
4050-346 Porto

Schedule:
April to September:
8h00 to 21h00.
October to March:
8h00 to 19h00.

It is one of the most iconic green spaces of the city and includes the gardens of the Crystal Palace (built in the 1860s with granite, iron and glass), the Pavilion Rosa Mota (that replaced the Palace in 1956), the Quinta of the Macieirinha (where the Romantic Museum is located), and the Quinta Tait. The romantic gardens, designed by architect Émile David are spread over 8 acres of exotic rare plants, large trees, rose gardens, fountains, a lake with ducks and swans, and a cafeteria with a terrace where proud peacocks surprise visitors. Offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Douro River and the sea, the gardens are still the home of the Almeida Garrett Municipal Library and of the Municipal Gallery of Porto.

Sao Bento Railway Station

Address:
Praça de Almeida Garrett,
4000-069 Porto

Schedule:
Sunday to Saturday:
5h00 to 1h00.

The São Bento Railway Station is an early twentieth century building that is worth a visit, but not just for its architecture by the architect Marques da Silva, who also designed other important works of the city. It features a glass and cast iron roof, but its centerpiece is the remarkable set of 20 000 painted tiles that covers the lobby of the station by the painter Jorge Colaço. The murals illustrate the evolution of transports as well as scenes from Portuguese life and history.

Santa Catarina Street

Santa Catarina Street, with a length of 1,500 meters, is known as the commercial artery of the city. In particular it\'s pedestrianized section, which has a bit of everything from fashion and footwear stores to restaurants and cafes, you can also expect to see gourmet products and even tattoo studios.

Clerigos Tower

Address:
Rua São Filipe Nery,
4050-546 Porto

Schedule:
Sunday to Saturday:
9h00 to 19h00.

Price:
Access to the church: Free.
Regular ticket to access the tower + exposition: 4,00€
Porto card to access the tower: 1,50€
School visits to access the tower: 1,50€ (per person)
Clergy, scouts and children under 10 years-old to access the tower: Free

The Clérigos Tower was built between 1754 and 1763 by Nicolau Nasoni and is one of the landmarks of Porto. In 1731, the Brotherhood of the Clérigos (Clergymen) decided to build this remarkable building for religious worship. The tower, whose 250th anniversary was marked with pomp and circumstance in 2013, has six floors and a height of 76 meters. There are 255 steps to the top. A demanding climb, that will be rewarded with a 360 degree view over the city.

Dom Luis I Bridge

The grand Luís I Bridge was designed by Teófilo Seyrig, who was a disciple of the famous French engineer Gustave Eiffel. It was inaugurated in 1886. It\'s composed of two overlapping wrought iron decks. It is 395 meters long and 8 wide, and the arch remains the world\'s longest spanning wrought iron arch.

Avenida dos Aliados

Aliados Avenue, which is marked on the North top by the Porto City Hall building, is known as the "living room" of the city, by the magnificence of its architectural heritage but also for its central character - is the home of the homonymous metro station. It is, par excellence, where the inhabitants of Porto meet to celebrate special moments, such as the night of S. João, the New Year celebrations or whenever the main club of the city, Futebol Clube do Porto, wins one important title. It is composed of granite buildings, huge and crowned skylights, domes and pinnacles. In the large central plaque, comes alive the statue of the Portuguese writer Almeida Garrett and is worth mentioning a water mirror.

Lello Bookshop

Address:
Rua das Carmelitas 144,
4050-161 Porto

Schedule: Monday to Friday:
10h30 to 19h30
Saturday:
10h00 to 19h00
To photograph the space from Monday to Friday:
9h00 to 10h00.

Price: 4 Euro

As the bookshop is currently closed at this time, it is necessary to knock on the door.

Located at Rua das Carmelitas, the Lello Bookshop was considered the third most beautiful bookshop in the world by the British newspaper “The Guardian”. It was inaugurated in 1906 and it was first called Chardron. This name, which is still on the façade, was the name of the publisher that Lello brothers bought along with the building. It is known for its staircase in the center of the bookshop that was considered to be the first example of the use of reinforced concrete in Portugal.

House of Music

Address:
Avenida da Boavista, 604-610,
4149-071 Porto

Schedule:
Building, store and box office:
Monday to Saturday:
10h00 to 19h00.
Sunday and holidays:
10h00 to 18h00.
On days with show, the closure is half an hour after the start of the show.
Restaurant:
Monday to Thrusday:
12h30 to 15h00 and 19h30 to 23h00.
Friday to Saturday:
12h30 to 15h00 and 19h30 to 0h00.
On concert night the bar closes at 1h00.

Price:
Guided visit: 3,00€ to 7,50€.

The House of Music is the first building in Portugal exclusively dedicated to music and was designed as part of Porto’s project for European Capital of Culture in 2001. It was designed by the Dutch architect Rem Koolhaas and opened in 2005. It is a center for the promotion of the national and international music scene, and features an eclectic programming, including several free shows. It offers guided tours for different audiences. For about an hour, visitors can be led by a guide who will explain how the architecture, functionalities and artistic programming all relate to each other. You can choose between regular daily visits - in Portuguese and English, and visits custom-designed for your group and available in multiple languages and by appointment. The sightseeing tour allows visitors to explore the building in a relaxed and seductive atmosphere, which includes in the end a glass of Porto wine or a visit backstage that will give you an idea of the daily dynamics of preparing concerts.

Castelo do Queijo

Address:
Praça Gonçalves Zarco,
Porto

Schedule:
Winter
Tuesday to Sunday:
13h00 to 17h00.
Summer
Tuesday to Sunday:
13h00 to 18h00.

Price:
Access to the fort: 0,50€

Cheese Castle is the popular name by which everyone knows the Fort São Francisco Xavier. Why? It was built in the seventeenth century to prevent incursions by pirates from North Africa. This former defensive fortification was built where there was a huge rounded stone that resembled a wheel of cheese. Cheese Castle also designates the beach near the fort. The small beach is about 140 meters long and is dominated by rocky outcrops.

Capela das Almas

Address:
Rua de Santa Catarina 428,
4000-444 Porto, Portugal

Capela das Almas (literally, the Chapel of Souls) is located in the vicinity of the Carmo Church in Porto. It is often referred to as the Chapel of Santa Catarina, and it is a definite must-visit for holidaymakers of Porto. The exterior walls of the edifice are virtually entirely covered with blue and white ceramic tiles which depict scenes like the Death of Saint Francis of Assisi and the Martyrdom of Santa Catarina (the chapel being dedicated to Santa Catarina). The tile work was realized in the first half of the 20th century (1929) by Eduardo Leite, and what is worth noting in this respect is the artist splendidly mimicked the classic style of the 18th century, following closely the guidelines of the trend. The stained glass windows of the facade are the work of Amandio Silva, realized in the 19th century.

World of Discoveries. Interactive Museum and Theme Park

Address:
Rua de Miragaia,
4050-387 Porto

Schedule:
Monday to Friday:
10h00 to 18h00.
Saturday to Sunday:
10h00 to 19h00.

Price:
Regular ticket: 14,00€
Pensioners and students: 11,00€
Children between 4 and 12 years-old: 8,00€
Schools: 6,00€ (per person)
Children until 3 years-old: Free

Housed inside the old warehouses of Real Companhia Velha in Miragaia, the World of Discoveries - Interactive Museum and Theme Park is a museum dedicated to the Portuguese Discoveries, where visitors can step into the shoes of the Portuguese navigators who crossed the oceans to reach an unknown world. In a navigable area with small boat replicas the sea routes pioneered by the Portuguese have been recreated, with routes that cross through China, Japan, Indonesia, India, North Africa and Brazil.

Porto City Park

Address:
Avenida da Boavista,
4781 - 4100 121 Porto

Situated in one of the largest parks in Northern Portugal the "Parque da Cidade" where families meet at weekends is very busy. A walk through it will help you identify different species of plants and trees which you could see during your stay in Porto.

Praia da Luz

Address:
Rua Coronel Raul Peres,
Porto 4150-633, Portugal

Praia da Luz, in Foz do Douro, is a very cool beach, which is easy to access on foot and has free parking and a restaurant perched over the beach, just like a window on to the sea.

Fortaleza de Sao Joao da Foz

Address:
Esplanada Castelo,
Porto 4150-196, Portugal

Price: Free

The fortress was built at the end of the sixteenth century to protect the coast and the Douro entrance. Modern strongholds were added (sec. XVII) to the original structure of this fine example of military architecture and the access gate to the fort (18th century). It now hosts the Delegação Regional do Porto do Instituto de Defesa Nacional (Regional Office of the National Defense Institute. It has been listed as a building of public interest since 6 June 1967.

Farol de Felgueiras

Address:
Avenida Dom Carlos I,
Porto 4150-190, Portugal

The Farolim of Felgueiras or Lighthouse of Felgueiras on the right bank of the Douro River, is a Portuguese lighthouse that is located at the tip of the jetty of the same name, in the parish of Foz do Douro, City of Porto . This is a tower hexagonal in masonry of granite apparent, with ten meters high. It has red balcony and lantern, and a small annex building with plastered walls and painted white.

Club Musica 80’

Address:
Rua da Restauracao 39,
Porto 4050-503, Portugal

This space is, as the name implies, a place of fun where you can recall the great sounds of the 80s. Decorated in shades of black and blue, and intimate setting, silver columns and mirrors show without a doubt that there is a certain luxury, but without baroque touches. It is ideal for pleasant conversations interspersed with moments of dancing to the best music site.

Twiggy Events Pub

Address:
Rua do Bolhao 193,
Porto 4000-111, Portugal

Opening hours:
22.00-04.00

Good local in Porto with live music, good drinks, good Porto wine. Live music all days and saturday with band. Music type: latin and world music to dance.

Cave 45

Address:
Rua das Oliveiras 45,
Porto 4050-449, Portugal

Opening hours:
Sunday: Closed
Monday: Closed
Thuesday: Closed
Wednesday: 22:00–04:00
Thursday: 22:00–04:00
Friday: 22:00–04:00
Saturday: 22:00–04:00

Before CAVE 45 there was not one bar in Porto solely dedicated to hard & pure ROCK - without any concession to electronic music, pop music or comercial music. As the monster created by Dr. Frankenstein, CAVE 45 is a monster composed by different parts, taken by this monster called ROCK, be it Garage, Hardcore, Metal, Punk, Rockabilly, Stoner … And what a better place for underground music than a basement? Besides the basement ("cave" in portuguese) itself CAVE 45 is composed by a ground floor. The ground floor is a bar with no dj\'s - the music is chosen by whoever is working at the bar. You can seat down, have a chat and a drink without being annoyed by extremely loud music, because a bar is not a disco. This space is open from wednesday till saturday. The basement ("the cave") is a bigger place, designed for concerts and parties, with walls painted by artists and tattooists chosen by us. This space is open only in weekend nights or when there are concerts being held.

Boulevard

Address:
Avenida dos Aliados 62,
Porto 4000-064, Portugal

Opening hours: Open only on Saturay.

Boulevard Aliados is a club located in the heart of Oporto\'s downtown. With a great view over the Avenida dos Aliados, Boulevard is one of the best places to dance, to meet beautiful people and have amazing cocktails.

Hot Five Jazz And Blues Club

Address:
Largo Actor Dias 51,
Porto 4000-192, Portugal

Opening hours:
Monday: Closed
Tuesday: Closed
Wednesday: 22:00 - 03:00
Thursday: 22:00 - 03:00
Friday: 22:00 - 04:00
Saturday: 22:00 - 04:00
Sunday: Closed

One of the city\'s best jazz clubs, Hot Five offers a great choice of live jazz and blues amid a buzzing atmosphere close to the city center.

Graham\'s Port Lodge

Address:
Rua Rei Ramiro 514,
4400-281 Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal

Opening hours:
Sun - Sat 09:30 - 18:00

Price: Visits (including tasting) from €12.

Originally built in 1890, Graham\'s Lodge was renovated in 2012 and now offers tours (in several languages) and Port tastings.

#2 of 68 things to do in Vila Nova de Gaia

Porto Augusto\'s

Address:
Rua de França,10,
4400-174 Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal

Opening hours:
Mon - Sun 11:00 - 18:00

Price: 5 Euro

Quinta dos Corvos

Address:
R. Dom Afonso III 2,
4400-266 Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugalia

#4 of 68 things to do in Vila Nova de Gaia

Taylor\'s Port

Address:
Rua de Choupelo 250,
Vila Nova de Gaia 4400-088, Portugal

Opening hours:
Mon - Fri 10:00 - 18:00
Sat - Sun 10:00 - 17:00

Price €12 (For the audio tour and tasting per person)

Taylor’s, accepted by most wine authorities to be the greatest of all port shippers invites you to an exciting and informative tour of its famous lodges at Vila Nova de Gaia.

#6 of 68 things to do in Vila Nova de Gaia
